definition: to steal (sb's heart)
see 勾當|勾当[gou4 dang4]
surname Gou
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: Black cat eyes took my soul.
sentences.chinese: 黑貓用眼睛勾走了我的魂。

sentences.english: She gives her body to men to take their souls in thrall.
sentences.chinese: 她以自己身體爲代價將男人們的靈魂勾走控制。

sentences.english: Let's run quick before they come and take our souls!
sentences.chinese: 我們趕快逃吧，免得他們來把我們的魂勾走。

definition: lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
to fascinate/to strongly attract/to obsess/to infatuate/to captivate/to enchant
to seduce/to tempt
sexy/seductive
(Tw) to like/to fall in love with
to knock sb out with a drug/to render sb unconscious
fox-spirit/vixen/witch/enchantress
to bend/(slang) to turn a straight person gay
to gang up/to fool around with/to make up to
to draw (towards)/to be drawn to/to be sucked in
to tether/to tie up/(fig.) to restrict/to keep a hold on
to lead astray
to be distracted
charming eyes/coquettish glances
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
lustful/lecherous
